6ffdca83-07d3-4ac0-a045-5bf3642bbef9.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge VET Trainer & Assessor Professional Development have completed professional development through the previous iteration of the IBSA Academy program. They will have a general knowledge of the VET system and training and assessment requirements.
6ffdca83-07d3-4ac0-a045-5bf3642bbef9.name: IBSA Academy: VET Trainer and Assessor Professional Development

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for at least one unit in the previous iteration of the IBSA Academy program.

fa700694-ee94-4e29-b499-9e850eff805e.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Addressing language, literacy and numeracy skills’ have a fundamental understanding of the foundations of LLN (language, literacy and numeracy) and the Australian Core Skills Framework (ACSF). They know and demonstrate how to identify the LLN skills required in a training package, and how to determine learners' LLN skills. These candidates are able to create effective strategies for supporting learners' LLN needs and increasing learners’ LLN skills.
fa700694-ee94-4e29-b499-9e850eff805e.name: IBSA Academy: Addressing language, literacy and numeracy skills

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Addressing language, literacy and numeracy skills'

0c35db9e-f1ec-499f-b5db-6f32c080dffa.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Designing assessment tools’ have a fundamental understanding of the types and purposes of different assessment tools, and the standards and requirements that assessment tools must meet. They demonstrate the ability to plan an assessment and choose the most accurate, valid, fair and reliable assessment methods and assessment tools. These candidates are able to quality check, review and trial assessment tools.
0c35db9e-f1ec-499f-b5db-6f32c080dffa.name: IBSA Academy: Designing assessment tools

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Designing assessment tools'

85a44245-8370-4206-baef-ca5c9cfd7719.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘The assessment toolbox’ have a fundamental understanding of the assessment process, including key terminology, designing assessment tools and instruments, planning assessment, and recording results. They know and demonstrate how to plan for assessment and design assessment tools and instruments. These candidates are able to create assessment tools that are quality checked, and complete the administration and reporting components of the assessment process.
85a44245-8370-4206-baef-ca5c9cfd7719.name: IBSA Academy: The assessment toolbox

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'The assessment toolbox'

185e2189-0207-4c08-8439-8dc19afb64ff.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Unpacking a unit of competency’ have a fundamental understanding of the importance of unpacking units of competency (UoC) and the benchmarks of units of competency, including performance evidence, knowledge evidence, performance criteria, application, elements and foundation skills. They know and demonstrate how to unpack units of competency. These candidates are able to put all the components of a UoC together to plan effective assessments.
185e2189-0207-4c08-8439-8dc19afb64ff.name: IBSA Academy: Unpacking a unit of competency

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Unpacking a unit of competency'

7afd95f7-154d-40a2-ac7d-4a6709bd76dc.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Analysing training needs’ have a fundamental understanding of how to analyse training needs. They demonstrate the ability to identify sources of workplace data, collect and analyse staff data, interview staff, and identify skills gaps. These candidates are able to recommend a training program and assess the most effective delivery mode, content and options to address the training need.
7afd95f7-154d-40a2-ac7d-4a6709bd76dc.name: IBSA Academy: Analysing training needs

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Analysing training needs'

978acf7f-33a0-43da-9561-14bf9c504cbf.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Planning and delivering training sessions’ have a fundamental understanding of the importance of planning and documenting training sessions, the role of the session plan, and the requirements of recordkeeping and continuous improvement. These candidates demonstrate the ability to create training sessions and session plans, deliver training sessions, and gather feedback after training sessions to improve their training delivery.
978acf7f-33a0-43da-9561-14bf9c504cbf.name: IBSA Academy: Planning and delivering training sessions

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Planning and delivering training sessions'

9fd12c0c-a3a4-45fc-9a09-f3f22f2f8ec6.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Teaching online’ have a fundamental understanding of how classroom and online teaching are similar and how they are different. They demonstrate the ability to understand the basic tools and principles used in online learning and teaching, and the types of content used in and created for online teaching. These candidates demonstrate the ability to create an action plan to move their teaching from the classroom to an online environment.
9fd12c0c-a3a4-45fc-9a09-f3f22f2f8ec6.name: IBSA Academy: Teaching online

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Teaching online'

64448938-66ba-4361-91c1-e4fcff5c47a8.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Completing your trainer skills matrix’ have a fundamental understanding of the purpose and format of the trainer skills matrix as required by the Standards for RTOs 2015, including common pitfalls and mistakes of completing the matrix. They demonstrate the ability to select the best evidence to demonstrate VET and industry competency and currency. These candidates are able to complete the trainer skills matrix and keep it updated, compliant and current.
64448938-66ba-4361-91c1-e4fcff5c47a8.name: IBSA Academy: Completing your trainer skills matrix

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Completing your trainer skills matrix'

1d289174-1948-442f-b159-034a71d45f9e.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Customising and contextualising training programs’ have a fundamental understanding of the difference between customisation and contextualisation. The know and demonstrate knowledge of the rules and guidelines for customising and contextualising components of accredited training. These candidates are able to customise a course and contextualise its contents, consult to identify needs and determine delivery methods and modifications to training resources.
1d289174-1948-442f-b159-034a71d45f9e.name: IBSA Academy: Customising and contextualising training programs

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Customising and contextualising training programs'

a20a47b3-2533-4076-955e-ffe74826c576.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Getting and using feedback from learners’ have a fundamental understanding of formal and informal feedback from learners, and why it is needed. They know and demonstrate how to apply feedback collection methods, and how to report on the findings of the feedback. These candidates are able to create an action plan to implement learners’ feedback and improve their learning programs.
a20a47b3-2533-4076-955e-ffe74826c576.name: IBSA Academy: Getting and using feedback from learners

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Getting and using feedback from learners'

fe5fe555-a2ec-4bed-ac67-021af6ce12b3.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘RTO compliance – Not my job!’ have a fundamental understanding of the compliance responsibilities of different roles in Vocational Education and Training (VET). They demonstrate understanding of the Australian Skills Quality Authority (ASQA) Standards, and how they apply to RTOs, training managers and trainers. These candidates demonstrate the ability to prepare for and respond to ASQA audits as a VET professional.
fe5fe555-a2ec-4bed-ac67-021af6ce12b3.name: IBSA Academy: RTO compliance – Not my job!

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'RTO compliance – Not my job!'

5e472bac-7bf3-4272-8537-c4b2eda6fafd.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Training package transitions’ have a fundamental understanding of training packages, how they are created and how they are updated. They understand the training package transition process, the organisations involved in creating and updating training packages, and the requirements of the RTO under the Standards for RTOs 2015. These candidates are able to inform, support and advise learners affected by training package transition process.
5e472bac-7bf3-4272-8537-c4b2eda6fafd.name: IBSA Academy: Training package transitions

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Training package transitions'

11f12459-90a5-4523-965c-6774500fbd20.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Understanding RPL and guiding candidates through it’ have a fundamental understanding of what recognition of prior learning (RPL) is and how it works, including its requirements under the Australian Qualifications Framework (AQF) and the Standards for RTOs 2015. They know and demonstrate the benchmarks a candidate must meet, the kinds of evidence needed, and how RPL is assessed. These candidates are able to assist learners throughout the entire RPL process.
11f12459-90a5-4523-965c-6774500fbd20.name: IBSA Academy: Understanding RPL and guiding candidates through it

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Understanding RPL and guiding candidates through it'

d6405a83-9f9f-4cd2-b834-57e5f8674200.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Time management’ have a fundamental understanding of the benefits of time management, and the techniques for effective time management. They demonstrate understanding of how to create effective to-do lists, calendars and action plans, organise and prioritise tasks, and deal with time wasters and distractions.
d6405a83-9f9f-4cd2-b834-57e5f8674200.name: IBSA Academy: Time management

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Time management'

50de7f78-0b28-4526-98f9-e14e4daad97c.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Emotional intelligence and leadership’ have a fundamental understanding of emotional intelligence (EI) competencies and techniques, and how to apply them to leadership practice. They demonstrate the ability to recognise their emotions and the emotions of others, lead in an emotionally intelligent manner during times of challenge, and develop and apply emotional intelligence techniques to improve outcomes for themselves, their team and their organisation.
50de7f78-0b28-4526-98f9-e14e4daad97c.name: IBSA Academy: Emotional intelligence and leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Emotional intelligence and leadership'

7ce16f3a-8d62-4963-8ff2-dfb8c12f23d6.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Emotional intelligence and training’ have a fundamental understanding of emotional intelligence (EI) competencies and techniques, and how to apply them to training. They demonstrate the ability to increase emotional intelligence in themselves and their learners, and apply EI competencies to modern learning environments and challenging learner situations. These candidates have set intentions to improve their EI and assist learners to apply EI in their lives.
7ce16f3a-8d62-4963-8ff2-dfb8c12f23d6.name: IBSA Academy: Emotional intelligence and training

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Emotional intelligence and training'

531e4098-78cb-4875-a198-f63c1f03dbbd.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Setting goals and priorities’ have a fundamental understanding of the importance of setting goals. They know how to set and achieve their goals and demonstrate the ability to set SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant and Timeframed) goals and objectives to set themselves up for success. These candidates demonstrate the ability to prioritise effectively and achieve their short- and long-term personal and professional goals.
531e4098-78cb-4875-a198-f63c1f03dbbd.name: IBSA Academy: Setting goals and priorities

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Setting goals and priorities'

d70f5f63-1d36-4552-aae0-6733df81b7b9.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Good working habits’ have a fundamental understanding of how habits form, why habits are difficult to change, and how to replace bad habits with good habits. They demonstrate the ability to identify habits in their own life, develop strategies for creating new habits and create good habits in the workplace that will increase their productivity and emotional and physical wellbeing.
d70f5f63-1d36-4552-aae0-6733df81b7b9.name: IBSA Academy: Good working habits

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Good working habits'

65290b47-f23a-44b5-89e0-956bd818ba0d.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘The VET system – What is it?’ have a fundamental understanding of the history of Vocational Education and Training (VET) and the acronyms and organisations associated with it, including the Standards for RTOs 2015 and Training.gov.au. They demonstrate understanding of how the VET system is measured and monitored, how industry and government work together to decide training content, and how learners access VET and are assigned Unique Student Identifiers (USIs).
65290b47-f23a-44b5-89e0-956bd818ba0d.name: IBSA Academy: The VET system – What is it?

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'The VET system – What is it?'

f08de51e-e91f-4c39-ac3b-807ef6070087.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Building professional networks’ have a fundamental understanding of the benefits of networking. They demonstrate the ability to identify their networking goals, build a professional network through events, technology (such as LinkedIn) and meetings, and maintain their network once it is built. They have an understanding of what makes networking organisations successful, and the potential problems with networks.
f08de51e-e91f-4c39-ac3b-807ef6070087.name: IBSA Academy: Building professional networks

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Building professional networks'

4649e55a-600e-4cd9-b9e8-e9bf412492cb.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Validation in the Standards for RTOs 2015’ have a fundamental understanding of the process of validation in the context of the Standards for RTOs 2015, including the credentials and skills needed for participating trainers, assessors and industry experts, and the importance of random, statistically valid sampling. They know and demonstrate how to plan validation and how to identify and record suitable actions following validation outcomes.
4649e55a-600e-4cd9-b9e8-e9bf412492cb.name: IBSA Academy: Validation in the Standards for RTOs 2015

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Validation in the Standards for RTOs 2015'

347bbbec-1200-4f8e-a39e-c47d014f0527.description: Earners of the IBSA Academy badge ‘Volume of learning and amount of training’ have a fundamental understanding of the relationship between volume of learning (VoL), amount of training and nominal hours, and how they fit into the requirements of a qualification. They know and demonstrate how to calculate volume of learning for qualifications and units, and how to develop a Training and Assessment Strategy (TAS) that covers the required volume of learning.
347bbbec-1200-4f8e-a39e-c47d014f0527.name: IBSA Academy: Volume of learning and amount of training

badge_template_activities.title: Complete required training and coursework for IBSA Academy module 'Volume of learning and amount of training'
